description.full:
get a reference to an existing instance

Examples

// provided a container with an ID of "tree", and a nested node with an ID of "branch"
// all of there will return the same instance
$.jstree.reference('tree');
$.jstree.reference('#tree');
$.jstree.reference($('#tree'));
$.jstree.reference(document.getElementByID('tree'));
$.jstree.reference('branch');
$.jstree.reference('#branch');
$.jstree.reference($('#branch'));
$.jstree.reference(document.getElementByID('branch'));
description.summary: get a reference to an existing instance
description.body:
Examples

// provided a container with an ID of "tree", and a nested node with an ID of "branch"
// all of there will return the same instance
$.jstree.reference('tree');
$.jstree.reference('#tree');
$.jstree.reference($('#tree'));
$.jstree.reference(document.getElementByID('tree'));
$.jstree.reference('branch');
$.jstree.reference('#branch');
$.jstree.reference($('#branch'));
$.jstree.reference(document.getElementByID('branch'));

description.full:
Create an instance, get an instance or invoke a command on a instance.

If there is no instance associated with the current node a new one is created and arg is used to extend $.jstree.defaults for this new instance. There would be no return value (chaining is not broken).

If there is an existing instance and arg is a string the command specified by arg is executed on the instance, with any additional arguments passed to the function. If the function returns a value it will be returned (chaining could break depending on function).

If there is an existing instance and arg is not a string the instance itself is returned (similar to $.jstree.reference).

In any other case - nothing is returned and chaining is not broken.

Examples

$('#tree1').jstree(); // creates an instance
$('#tree2').jstree({ plugins : [] }); // create an instance with some options
$('#tree1').jstree('open_node', '#branch_1'); // call a method on an existing instance, passing additional arguments
$('#tree2').jstree(); // get an existing instance (or create an instance)
$('#tree2').jstree(true); // get an existing instance (will not create new instance)
$('#branch_1').jstree().select_node('#branch_1'); // get an instance (using a nested element and call a method)
description.summary: Create an instance, get an instance or invoke a command on a instance.
description.body:
If there is no instance associated with the current node a new one is created and arg is used to extend $.jstree.defaults for this new instance. There would be no return value (chaining is not broken).

If there is an existing instance and arg is a string the command specified by arg is executed on the instance, with any additional arguments passed to the function. If the function returns a value it will be returned (chaining could break depending on function).

If there is an existing instance and arg is not a string the instance itself is returned (similar to $.jstree.reference).

In any other case - nothing is returned and chaining is not broken.

Examples

$('#tree1').jstree(); // creates an instance
$('#tree2').jstree({ plugins : [] }); // create an instance with some options
$('#tree1').jstree('open_node', '#branch_1'); // call a method on an existing instance, passing additional arguments
$('#tree2').jstree(); // get an existing instance (or create an instance)
$('#tree2').jstree(true); // get an existing instance (will not create new instance)
$('#branch_1').jstree().select_node('#branch_1'); // get an instance (using a nested element and call a method)

description.full:
used to find elements containing an instance

Examples

$('div:jstree').each(function () {
    $(this).jstree('destroy');
});
description.summary: used to find elements containing an instance

description.full: stores all defaults for the core
description.summary: stores all defaults for the core

code: $.jstree.defaults.core = {

description.full:
data configuration

If left as false the HTML inside the jstree container element is used to populate the tree (that should be an unordered list with list items).

You can also pass in a HTML string or a JSON array here.

It is possible to pass in a standard jQuery-like AJAX config and jstree will automatically determine if the response is JSON or HTML and use that to populate the tree.
In addition to the standard jQuery ajax options here you can suppy functions for data and url, the functions will be run in the current instance's scope and a param will be passed indicating which node is being loaded, the return value of those functions will be used.

The last option is to specify a function, that function will receive the node being loaded as argument and a second param which is a function which should be called with the result.

Examples

// AJAX
$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'data' : {
            'url' : '/get/children/',
            'data' : function (node) {
                return { 'id' : node.id };
            }
        }
    });

// direct data
$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'data' : [
            'Simple root node',
            {
                'id' : 'node_2',
                'text' : 'Root node with options',
                'state' : { 'opened' : true, 'selected' : true },
                'children' : [ { 'text' : 'Child 1' }, 'Child 2']
            }
        ]
    });

// function
$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'data' : function (obj, callback) {
            callback.call(this, ['Root 1', 'Root 2']);
        }
    });
description.summary: data configuration
description.body:
If left as false the HTML inside the jstree container element is used to populate the tree (that should be an unordered list with list items).

You can also pass in a HTML string or a JSON array here.

It is possible to pass in a standard jQuery-like AJAX config and jstree will automatically determine if the response is JSON or HTML and use that to populate the tree.
In addition to the standard jQuery ajax options here you can suppy functions for data and url, the functions will be run in the current instance's scope and a param will be passed indicating which node is being loaded, the return value of those functions will be used.

The last option is to specify a function, that function will receive the node being loaded as argument and a second param which is a function which should be called with the result.

Examples

// AJAX
$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'data' : {
            'url' : '/get/children/',
            'data' : function (node) {
                return { 'id' : node.id };
            }
        }
    });

// direct data
$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'data' : [
            'Simple root node',
            {
                'id' : 'node_2',
                'text' : 'Root node with options',
                'state' : { 'opened' : true, 'selected' : true },
                'children' : [ { 'text' : 'Child 1' }, 'Child 2']
            }
        ]
    });

// function
$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'data' : function (obj, callback) {
            callback.call(this, ['Root 1', 'Root 2']);
        }
    });

code: data			: false,

description.full:
configure the various strings used throughout the tree

You can use an object where the key is the string you need to replace and the value is your replacement.
Another option is to specify a function which will be called with an argument of the needed string and should return the replacement.
If left as false no replacement is made.

Examples

$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'strings' : {
            'Loading...' : 'Please wait ...'
        }
    }
});
description.summary: configure the various strings used throughout the tree
description.body:
You can use an object where the key is the string you need to replace and the value is your replacement.
Another option is to specify a function which will be called with an argument of the needed string and should return the replacement.
If left as false no replacement is made.

Examples

$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'strings' : {
            'Loading...' : 'Please wait ...'
        }
    }
});

code: strings			: false,

description.full:
determines what happens when a user tries to modify the structure of the tree
If left as false all operations like create, rename, delete, move or copy are prevented.
You can set this to true to allow all interactions or use a function to have better control.

Examples

$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'check_callback' : function (operation, node, node_parent, node_position, more) {
            // operation can be 'create_node', 'rename_node', 'delete_node', 'move_node' or 'copy_node'
            // in case of 'rename_node' node_position is filled with the new node name
            return operation === 'rename_node' ? true : false;
        }
    }
});
description.summary:
determines what happens when a user tries to modify the structure of the tree
If left as false all operations like create, rename, delete, move or copy are prevented.
You can set this to true to allow all interactions or use a function to have better control.
description.body:
Examples

$('#tree').jstree({
    'core' : {
        'check_callback' : function (operation, node, node_parent, node_position, more) {
            // operation can be 'create_node', 'rename_node', 'delete_node', 'move_node' or 'copy_node'
            // in case of 'rename_node' node_position is filled with the new node name
            return operation === 'rename_node' ? true : false;
        }
    }
});

code: check_callback	: false,

description.summary: a boolean specifying if a reponsive version of the theme should kick in on smaller screens (if the theme supports it). Defaults to true.

		},

description.full: gets the current state of the tree so that it can be restored later with set_state(state). Used internally.
description.summary: gets the current state of the tree so that it can be restored later with set_state(state). Used internally.

description.full:
'themes' : {
'name' : this.get_theme(),
'icons' : this.data.core.themes.icons,
'dots' : this.data.core.themes.dots
},
description.summary:
'themes' : {
'name' : this.get_theme(),
'icons' : this.data.core.themes.icons,
'dots' : this.data.core.themes.dots
},

tags.name: state
tags.description: the state to restore

tags.name: callback
tags.description: an optional function to execute once the state is restored.

description.full: sets the state of the tree. Used internally.
description.summary: sets the state of the tree. Used internally.

description.full:
if(state.core.themes) {
if(state.core.themes.name) {
this.set_theme(state.core.themes.name);
}
if(typeof state.core.themes.dots !== 'undefined') {
this state.core.themes.dots ? "show_dots" : "hide_dots" ;
}
if(typeof state.core.themes.icons !== 'undefined') {
this state.core.themes.icons ? "show_icons" : "hide_icons" ;
}
delete state.core.themes;
delete state.core.open;
this.set_state(state, callback);
return false;
}
description.summary:
if(state.core.themes) {
if(state.core.themes.name) {
this.set_theme(state.core.themes.name);
}
if(typeof state.core.themes.dots !== 'undefined') {
this state.core.themes.dots ? "show_dots" : "hide_dots" ;
}
if(typeof state.core.themes.icons !== 'undefined') {
this state.core.themes.icons ? "show_icons" : "hide_icons" ;
}
delete state.core.themes;
delete state.core.open;
this.set_state(state, callback);
return false;
}

description.full:
Checkbox plugin

This plugin renders checkbox icons in front of each node, making multiple selection much easier.
It also supports tri-state behavior, meaning that if a node has a few of its children checked it will be rendered as undetermined, and state will be propagated up.
description.summary: Checkbox plugin
description.body:
This plugin renders checkbox icons in front of each node, making multiple selection much easier.
It also supports tri-state behavior, meaning that if a node has a few of its children checked it will be rendered as undetermined, and state will be propagated up.

code:
var _i = document.createElement('I');
	_i.className = 'jstree-icon jstree-checkbox';

description.full: stores all defaults for the checkbox plugin
description.summary: stores all defaults for the checkbox plugin

code: $.jstree.defaults.checkbox = {

description.summary: a boolean indicating if checkboxes should cascade down and have an undetermined state. Defaults to true.

description.full: a boolean indicating if clicking anywhere on the node should act as clicking on the checkbox. Defaults to true.
description.summary: a boolean indicating if clicking anywhere on the node should act as clicking on the checkbox. Defaults to true.

code: whole_node			: true,

description.full:
Contextmenu plugin

Shows a context menu when a node is right-clicked.
description.summary: Contextmenu plugin
description.body: Shows a context menu when a node is right-clicked.

code: // TODO: move logic outside of function + check multiple move

description.full: stores all defaults for the contextmenu plugin
description.summary: stores all defaults for the contextmenu plugin

code: $.jstree.defaults.contextmenu = {

description.full: a boolean indicating if the node should be selected when the context menu is invoked on it. Defaults to true.
description.summary: a boolean indicating if the node should be selected when the context menu is invoked on it. Defaults to true.

code: select_node : true,

description.full: a boolean indicating if the menu should be shown aligned with the node. Defaults to true, otherwise the mouse coordinates are used.
description.summary: a boolean indicating if the menu should be shown aligned with the node. Defaults to true, otherwise the mouse coordinates are used.

code: show_at_node : true,

description.full:
an object of actions, or a function that accepts a node and a callback function and calls the callback function with an object of actions available for that node (you can also return the items too).

Each action consists of a key (a unique name) and a value which is an object with the following properties (only label and action are required):

  • separator_before - a boolean indicating if there should be a separator before this item
  • separator_after - a boolean indicating if there should be a separator after this item
  • _disabled - a boolean indicating if this action should be disabled
  • label - a string - the name of the action (could be a function returning a string)
  • action - a function to be executed if this item is chosen
  • icon - a string, can be a path to an icon or a className, if using an image that is in the current directory use a ./ prefix, otherwise it will be detected as a class
  • shortcut - keyCode which will trigger the action if the menu is open (for example 113 for rename, which equals F2)
  • shortcut_label - shortcut label (like for example F2 for rename)
description.summary: an object of actions, or a function that accepts a node and a callback function and calls the callback function with an object of actions available for that node (you can also return the items too).
description.body:
Each action consists of a key (a unique name) and a value which is an object with the following properties (only label and action are required):

  • separator_before - a boolean indicating if there should be a separator before this item
  • separator_after - a boolean indicating if there should be a separator after this item
  • _disabled - a boolean indicating if this action should be disabled
  • label - a string - the name of the action (could be a function returning a string)
  • action - a function to be executed if this item is chosen
  • icon - a string, can be a path to an icon or a className, if using an image that is in the current directory use a ./ prefix, otherwise it will be detected as a class
  • shortcut - keyCode which will trigger the action if the menu is open (for example 113 for rename, which equals F2)
  • shortcut_label - shortcut label (like for example F2 for rename)

description.full:
"shortcut" : 113,
"shortcut_label" : 'F2',
"icon" : "glyphicon glyphicon-leaf",
description.summary:
"shortcut" : 113,
"shortcut_label" : 'F2',
"icon" : "glyphicon glyphicon-leaf",

description.full:
if(!('oncontextmenu' in document.body) && ('ontouchstart' in document.body)) {
var el = null, tm = null;
this.element
.on("touchstart", ".jstree-anchor", function (e) {
el = e.currentTarget;
tm = +new Date();
$(document).one("touchend", function (e) {
e.target = document.elementFromPoint(e.originalEvent.targetTouches[0].pageX - window.pageXOffset, e.originalEvent.targetTouches[0].pageY - window.pageYOffset);
e.currentTarget = e.target;
tm = ((+(new Date())) - tm);
if(e.target === el && tm > 600 && tm < 1000) {
e.preventDefault();
$(el).trigger('contextmenu', e);
}
el = null;
tm = null;
});
});
}
description.summary:
if(!('oncontextmenu' in document.body) && ('ontouchstart' in document.body)) {
var el = null, tm = null;
this.element
.on("touchstart", ".jstree-anchor", function (e) {
el = e.currentTarget;
tm = +new Date();
$(document).one("touchend", function (e) {
e.target = document.elementFromPoint(e.originalEvent.targetTouches[0].pageX - window.pageXOffset, e.originalEvent.targetTouches[0].pageY - window.pageYOffset);
e.currentTarget = e.target;
tm = ((+(new Date())) - tm);
if(e.target === el && tm > 600 && tm < 1000) {
e.preventDefault();
$(el).trigger('contextmenu', e);
}
el = null;
tm = null;
});
});
}

description.full:
Drag'n'drop plugin

Enables dragging and dropping of nodes in the tree, resulting in a move or copy operations.
description.summary: Drag'n'drop plugin
description.body: Enables dragging and dropping of nodes in the tree, resulting in a move or copy operations.

description.full: stores all defaults for the drag'n'drop plugin
description.summary: stores all defaults for the drag'n'drop plugin

code: $.jstree.defaults.dnd = {

description.full: a boolean indicating if a copy should be possible while dragging (by pressint the meta key or Ctrl). Defaults to true.
description.summary: a boolean indicating if a copy should be possible while dragging (by pressint the meta key or Ctrl). Defaults to true.

code: copy : true,

description.full: a number indicating how long a node should remain hovered while dragging to be opened. Defaults to 500.
description.summary: a number indicating how long a node should remain hovered while dragging to be opened. Defaults to 500.

code: open_timeout : 500,

description.full: a function invoked each time a node is about to be dragged, invoked in the tree's scope and receives the nodes about to be dragged as an argument (array) - return false to prevent dragging
description.summary: a function invoked each time a node is about to be dragged, invoked in the tree's scope and receives the nodes about to be dragged as an argument (array) - return false to prevent dragging

code: is_draggable : true,

description.full: a boolean indicating if checks should constantly be made while the user is dragging the node (as opposed to checking only on drop), default is true
description.summary: a boolean indicating if checks should constantly be made while the user is dragging the node (as opposed to checking only on drop), default is true

code: check_while_dragging : true,

description.full: a boolean indicating if nodes from this tree should only be copied with dnd (as opposed to moved), default is false
description.summary: a boolean indicating if nodes from this tree should only be copied with dnd (as opposed to moved), default is false

description.full:
// TODO: moving inside, but the node is not yet loaded?
// the check will work anyway, as when moving the node will be loaded first and checked again
if(v === 'i' && !ins.is_loaded(p)) { }
description.summary:
// TODO: moving inside, but the node is not yet loaded?
// the check will work anyway, as when moving the node will be loaded first and checked again
if(v === 'i' && !ins.is_loaded(p)) { }

description.full:
Search plugin

Adds search functionality to jsTree.
description.summary: Search plugin

description.full: stores all defaults for the search plugin
description.summary: stores all defaults for the search plugin

code: $.jstree.defaults.search = {

description.full:
a jQuery-like AJAX config, which jstree uses if a server should be queried for results.

A str (which is the search string) parameter will be added with the request. The expected result is a JSON array with nodes that need to be opened so that matching nodes will be revealed.
Leave this setting as false to not query the server. You can also set this to a function, which will be invoked in the instance's scope and receive 2 parameters - the search string and the callback to call with the array of nodes to load.
description.summary: a jQuery-like AJAX config, which jstree uses if a server should be queried for results.
description.body:
A str (which is the search string) parameter will be added with the request. The expected result is a JSON array with nodes that need to be opened so that matching nodes will be revealed.
Leave this setting as false to not query the server. You can also set this to a function, which will be invoked in the instance's scope and receive 2 parameters - the search string and the callback to call with the array of nodes to load.

code: ajax : false,

description.full: Indicates if the search should be fuzzy or not (should chnd3 match child node 3). Default is true.
description.summary: Indicates if the search should be fuzzy or not (should chnd3 match child node 3). Default is true.

code: fuzzy : true,

description.full: Indicates if the search should be case sensitive. Default is false.
description.summary: Indicates if the search should be case sensitive. Default is false.

code: case_sensitive : false,

description.full: Indicates if the tree should be filtered to show only matching nodes (keep in mind this can be a heavy on large trees in old browsers). Default is false.
description.summary: Indicates if the tree should be filtered to show only matching nodes (keep in mind this can be a heavy on large trees in old browsers). Default is false.

code: show_only_matches : false,

description.full: Indicates if all nodes opened to reveal the search result, should be closed when the search is cleared or a new search is performed. Default is true.
description.summary: Indicates if all nodes opened to reveal the search result, should be closed when the search is cleared or a new search is performed. Default is true.

code: close_opened_onclear : true,

description.full: Indicates if only leaf nodes should be included in search results. Default is false.
description.summary: Indicates if only leaf nodes should be included in search results. Default is false.

tags.name: str
tags.description: the search string

tags.name: skip_async
tags.description: if set to true server will not be queried even if configured

description.full: used to search the tree nodes for a given string
description.summary: used to search the tree nodes for a given string

tags.name: nodes
tags.description: a jQuery collection of matching nodes

tags.name: str
tags.description: the search string

tags.name: res
tags.description: a collection of objects represeing the matching nodes

description.full: triggered after search is complete
description.summary: triggered after search is complete

code:
this.trigger('search', { nodes : this._data.search.dom, str : str, res : this._data.search.res });
		};

description.full: used to clear the last search (removes classes and shows all nodes if filtering is on)
description.summary: used to clear the last search (removes classes and shows all nodes if filtering is on)

tags.name: nodes
tags.description: a jQuery collection of matching nodes (the result from the last search)

tags.name: str
tags.description: the search string (the last search string)

tags.name: res
tags.description: a collection of objects represeing the matching nodes (the result from the last search)

description.full: triggered after search is complete
description.summary: triggered after search is complete

tags.name: d
tags.description: an array of node IDs

description.full: opens nodes that need to be opened to reveal the search results. Used only internally.
description.summary: opens nodes that need to be opened to reveal the search results. Used only internally.

description.full:
Sort plugin

Autmatically sorts all siblings in the tree according to a sorting function.
description.summary: Sort plugin
description.body: Autmatically sorts all siblings in the tree according to a sorting function.

description.full:
the settings function used to sort the nodes.
It is executed in the tree's context, accepts two nodes as arguments and should return 1 or -1.
description.summary:
the settings function used to sort the nodes.
It is executed in the tree's context, accepts two nodes as arguments and should return 1 or -1.

tags.name: obj
tags.description: the node

tags.name: deep
tags.description: if set to `true` nodes are sorted recursively.

description.full: used to sort a node's children
description.summary: used to sort a node's children

description.full:
State plugin

Saves the state of the tree (selected nodes, opened nodes) on the user's computer using available options (localStorage, cookies, etc)
description.summary: State plugin
description.body: Saves the state of the tree (selected nodes, opened nodes) on the user's computer using available options (localStorage, cookies, etc)

code: var to = false;

description.full: stores all defaults for the state plugin
description.summary: stores all defaults for the state plugin

code: $.jstree.defaults.state = {

description.full: A string for the key to use when saving the current tree (change if using multiple trees in your project). Defaults to jstree.
description.summary: A string for the key to use when saving the current tree (change if using multiple trees in your project). Defaults to jstree.

code: key		: 'jstree',

description.full: A space separated list of events that trigger a state save. Defaults to changed.jstree open_node.jstree close_node.jstree.
description.summary: A space separated list of events that trigger a state save. Defaults to changed.jstree open_node.jstree close_node.jstree.

code: events	: 'changed.jstree open_node.jstree close_node.jstree',

description.full: Time in milliseconds after which the state will expire. Defaults to 'false' meaning - no expire.
description.summary: Time in milliseconds after which the state will expire. Defaults to 'false' meaning - no expire.

code: ttl		: false,

description.full: A function that will be executed prior to restoring state with one argument - the state object. Can be used to clear unwanted parts of the state.
description.summary: A function that will be executed prior to restoring state with one argument - the state object. Can be used to clear unwanted parts of the state.

description.full: save the state
description.summary: save the state

description.full: restore the state from the user's computer
description.summary: restore the state from the user's computer

description.full: clear the state on the user's computer
description.summary: clear the state on the user's computer

description.full:
Types plugin

Makes it possible to add predefined types for groups of nodes, which make it possible to easily control nesting rules and icon for each group.
description.summary: Types plugin
description.body: Makes it possible to add predefined types for groups of nodes, which make it possible to easily control nesting rules and icon for each group.

description.full:
An object storing all types as key value pairs, where the key is the type name and the value is an object that could contain following keys (all optional).

  • max_children the maximum number of immediate children this node type can have. Do not specify or set to -1 for unlimited.
  • max_depth the maximum number of nesting this node type can have. A value of 1 would mean that the node can have children, but no grandchildren. Do not specify or set to -1 for unlimited.
  • valid_children an array of node type strings, that nodes of this type can have as children. Do not specify or set to -1 for no limits.
  • icon a string - can be a path to an icon or a className, if using an image that is in the current directory use a ./ prefix, otherwise it will be detected as a class. Omit to use the default icon from your theme.

There are two predefined types:

  • # represents the root of the tree, for example max_children would control the maximum number of root nodes.
  • default represents the default node - any settings here will be applied to all nodes that do not have a type specified.
description.summary: An object storing all types as key value pairs, where the key is the type name and the value is an object that could contain following keys (all optional).
description.body:
• max_children the maximum number of immediate children this node type can have. Do not specify or set to -1 for unlimited.
  • max_depth the maximum number of nesting this node type can have. A value of 1 would mean that the node can have children, but no grandchildren. Do not specify or set to -1 for unlimited.
  • valid_children an array of node type strings, that nodes of this type can have as children. Do not specify or set to -1 for no limits.
  • icon a string - can be a path to an icon or a className, if using an image that is in the current directory use a ./ prefix, otherwise it will be detected as a class. Omit to use the default icon from your theme.

There are two predefined types:

  • # represents the root of the tree, for example max_children would control the maximum number of root nodes.
  • default represents the default node - any settings here will be applied to all nodes that do not have a type specified.

description.full:
Unique plugin

Enforces that no nodes with the same name can coexist as siblings.
description.summary: Unique plugin
description.body: Enforces that no nodes with the same name can coexist as siblings.

description.full:
Wholerow plugin

Makes each node appear block level. Making selection easier. May cause slow down for large trees in old browsers.
description.summary: Wholerow plugin
description.body: Makes each node appear block level. Making selection easier. May cause slow down for large trees in old browsers.
